intro: Roepera buxifolia, commonly known as the waxleaf roepera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Roepera buxifolia is typically grown as a houseplant or in warm, humid climates due to its preference for tropical conditions.
